description: Tectonics and Precision: Students in this course use the elemental logic of different materials and methods of construction to generate the design of a building of medium scale and complexity. Integration of building technologies with formal, environmental and aesthetic ambitions is pursued across all scales of a resolved design proposal. Documentation drawings and working models that precisely capture the means by which the design intent will be realised are produced.
prerequisites: ARCH1100 and ARCH1160 and ARCH1201 and BLDG1220
restricted: BArchDes students only. Study abroad students must seek Head of School's permission to enrol.
